channel.title: Mini game help
channel.description: I'm kinda making something in my server like a Mini-game so I want to make so when I kill the NPC it teleport's me back home and give items. I know this is confusing but can anyone help me?

item.title: Mini game help
item.dc:creator: @guitars595 guitars595
item.description:
@guitars595 wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:6, topic:222339”]For allstar, I found this in NPCHandler.java:

[code] if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1021) {
int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2660;
                            ppl.teleportToY = 4839;
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1020) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2713; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 4836; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 752) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2542; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 3029; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 275) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2608; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 3163; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 477) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2608; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 3159; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1919) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2866; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 9952; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 509) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2792; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 9325; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 274) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2540; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 3019; // Change coordinates
                        }

[/code]

It goes on longer. Basically just look at that :P[/quote]
Thanks so much[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 26, 2008, 06:16:58 pm[/size][hr]That works just fine but can I make it so when it teleport’s me it also adds an item to my inventory?

Read full topic

item.title: Mini game help
item.dc:creator: @iceman327 iceman327
item.description:
@iceman327 wrote:

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == ****){
int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];
ItemHandler.addItem(1,1);
ppl.teleportToX = 1234;
ppl.teleportToY = 4321;
ppl.sendMessage(“Congratz! heres your prize.”);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Mini game help
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

For allstar, I found this in NPCHandler.java:

[code] if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1021) {
int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2660;
                            ppl.teleportToY = 4839;
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1020) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2713; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 4836; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 752) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2542; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 3029; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 275) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2608; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 3163; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 477) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2608; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 3159; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1919) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2866; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 9952; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 509) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2792; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 9325; // Change coordinates
                        }
                        if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 274) {
                            int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
                            client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

                            ppl.teleportToX = 2540; // Change coordinates
                            ppl.teleportToY = 3019; // Change coordinates
                        }

[/code]

It goes on longer. Basically just look at that

item.description:

I could work of that. But you know how in Allstarscape they have like two minigames where when you kill someone it teleports you some where else? I’m trying to do that but I can’t figure it out.

item.title: Mini game help
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I have that if the last NPC drops a key, and then you use that on the chest, you get your reward and are teleported back home.

} else if (useItemID == 6104 && atObjectID == 4121) // reward { sendMessage( "Well done, you have just finished your mini game, here's your reward :)"); addSkillXP((200000 * playerLevel[2]), 2); deleteItem(6104, getItemSlot(6104), 1); addItem(7400, 1); teleportToX = 3248; teleportToY = 9364;

Work off of that maybe?

Read full topic
